raw_output:
system
You are a helpful AI for medical imaging.
user
System:
You are extracting factual relations from a medical imaging lecture. Use only information grounded in the input SLIDE_TEXT.

User:
SLIDE_TEXT:
Finally, here is your homework. You will use the MATLAB code available online to compute the Structural Similarity Index, or SSIM, between two images. SSIM is a perceptual metric that compares luminance, contrast, and structure.

Your task is two-fold. First, compute SSIM for a pair of images—either the ones shown here or another pair of your choice. Second, design an example where sensitivity is 90% and specificity is 80%, and show your calculations.

This exercise is meant to reinforce your understanding of both image quality metrics and diagnostic performance measures. The due date is one week later, so please manage your time accordingly.

STRICT INSTRUCTIONS:
- Return JSON only. No prose, no markdown, no code fences.
- Output a triple only if both subject and object appear verbatim in SLIDE_TEXT (case-insensitive).
- Predicates must be one of: uses | via | represents | depends_on | measures | produces | reconstructs_with.
- Add modalities ["text"] by default; add "image" only if clearly visible without the text.
- Confidence in [0,1].

OUTPUT:
{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"<verbatim subject>", "p":"uses|via|represents|depends_on|measures|produces|reconstructs_with",
     "o":"<verbatim object>", "modalities":["text","image"], "confidence":0.0, "evidence":"<short quote from SLIDE_TEXT>"}
  ]
}

assistant
{
  "triples": [
    {
      "s": "Use the MatLab code on http://www.cns.nyu.edu/~lcv/ssim/",
      "p": "uses",
      "o": "to compute SSIM of the two photos",
      "modalities": ["text", "image"],
      "confidence": 0.95,
      "evidence": "Use the MatLab code on http://www.cns.nyu.edu/~lcv/ssim/ to compute SSIM of the two photos (or other two photos):"
    },
    {
      "s": "Compute sensitivity and specificity",
      "p": "measures",
      "o": "sensitivity and specificity",
      "modalities": ["text"],
      "confidence": 0.95,
      "evidence": "• Compute sensitivity and specificity"
    },
    {
      "s": "Make an example so that sensitivity and specificity are 90% and 80% respectively",
      "p": "produces",
      "o": "sensitivity and specificity are 90% and 80% respectively",
      "modalities": ["text"],
      "confidence": 0.95,
